```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
library(tidyverse)
data = read_csv("uberresource.csv")
```

1. First we should delete the X1 and the surgemultiple because all the surge equals to 1.
```{r}
table(data$surge_multiplier)
data$surge_multiplier = NULL
data$X1 = NULL
data
```

```{r}
write_csv(data, "yanyuecleaned.csv")
```

2.
```{r}
rev_per_hour =data %>% select(hour, price,name) %>% group_by(hour, name) %>% count() %>% rename(revenue = n)

rev_per_hour %>% ggplot(aes(hour, revenue,color = name)) +
  geom_line()

```
